Eric_Paslay:
{{short description|American singer-songwriter}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Eric Paslay | image = Eric paslay.jpg | alt = A man with a red beard, wearing a black baseball cap, black t-shirt, and jeans. He is holding a brown guitar and singing into a microphone. | caption = Eric Paslay performing in 2015. | image_size = | landscape = | birth_name = Eric Thomas Paslay | alias = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1983|1|29|mf=y}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5390nJwDzIo|title=Happy Birthday, Eric Paslay!|date=January 29, 2014|publisher=[[YouTube]]|access-date=February 4, 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://www.publicrecords.com/people-search-records/eric-t-paslay-in-texas|title=Get Records for Eric T Paslay in Texas|publisher=PublicRecords.com|access-date=February 4, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222033056/http://www.publicrecords.com/people-search-records/eric-t-paslay-in-texas|archive-date=February 22, 2014|url-status=dead}} | birth_place = [[Abilene, Texas]], U.S.{{cite web|url=http://www.ericpaslay.com/about.html|title=Eric Paslay : About|website=Ericpaslay.com|access-date=February 4, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140407031055/http://www.ericpaslay.com/about.html|archive-date=April 7, 2014|url-status=dead}} | origin = [[Waco, Texas]], U.S.
[[Temple, Texas]], U.S. | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter | instrument = Vocals, guitar | years_active = 2011–present | label = [[Capitol Records Nashville|EMI Nashville]] }} '''Eric Thomas Paslay''' (born January 29, 1983) is an American [[country music]] singer and songwriter. He has released one album for EMI Nashville, which contains the hit singles "[[Friday Night (Eric Paslay song)|Friday Night]]", "[[Song About a Girl]]", and "[[She Don't Love You]]". In addition to these, Paslay has written several hit singles for other artists, and has collaborated with [[Amy Grant]], [[Dierks Bentley]], [[Charles Kelley]], among others. ==Early life== Eric Thomas Paslay was born in [[Abilene, Texas]], and started playing guitar at the age of 15. He graduated from [[Middle Tennessee State University]] in the fall of 2005 with his [[Bachelor of Science]] degree.{{cite web|url=http://www.mtsu.edu/news/gradlist/2005/GRADS_3.txt |title=MTSU Graduates Fall 2005 |year=2005 |publisher=MTSU |access-date=February 4, 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140221195527/http://www.mtsu.edu/news/gradlist/2005/GRADS_3.txt |archive-date=February 21, 2014 }} == Career == In mid-2011, Paslay signed to [[EMI Records]] Nashville. After his first two singles "[[Never Really Wanted]]" and "If the Fish Don't Bite" failed to make top 40, his third, "[[Friday Night (Eric Paslay song)|Friday Night]]", was a Top 5 hit on [[Country Airplay]] in early 2014. The song was originally recorded by [[Lady Antebellum]], and Paslay's version appears on his [[Eric Paslay (album)|self-titled debut album]], released in early 2014. The album went on to produce two more singles in "[[Song About a Girl]]" and "[[She Don't Love You]]". He also co-wrote [[Jake Owen]]'s "[[Barefoot Blue Jean Night (song)|Barefoot Blue Jean Night]]",{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/eric-paslay-interview-2011/|title=Eric Paslay Talks Debut Album and Getting His Start in Country Music|last=Conaway|first=Alanna|date=30 August 2011|work=Taste of Country|access-date=13 September 2011}} the [[Will Hoge]]/[[Eli Young Band]] song "[[Even If It Breaks Your Heart]]", and [[Love and Theft (band)|Love and Theft]]'s "[[Angel Eyes (Love and Theft song)|Angel Eyes]]"{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/love-and-theft-angel-eyes-lyrics/|title=Love and Theft, 'Angel Eyes' – Lyrics Uncovered|last=Conaway|first=Alanna|date=1 December 2011|work=Taste of Country|access-date=2 January 2012}} all of which were number 1 singles on the country charts. He has written album cuts for [[Lady A]]ntebellum,{{cite web|url=http://www.theboot.com/2011/09/06/eric-paslay-songwriter-jake-owen-barefoot-blue-jean-night/|title=Eric Paslay Is Getting Everything He 'Ever Wanted'|last=Stromblad|first=Cory|date=6 September 2011|work=The Boot|access-date=13 September 2011}} [[Rascal Flatts]]' 2014 single "[[Rewind (Rascal Flatts song)|Rewind]]" and [[Keith Urban]]'s 2021 single "[[Wild Hearts (song)|Wild Hearts]]". In 2013, Paslay appeared on [[Amy Grant]]'s album ''[[How Mercy Looks from Here]]'', sharing lead vocals with Grant and [[Sheryl Crow]] on a song he wrote called "Deep As It Is Wide". In publicity for the album, Grant stated that she is most excited about Paslay as an up-and-coming artist.{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/mobile/video/0,,20702287,00.html |title=Amy Grant: The 'Nasty' Way Vince Gill Makes Me Laugh |publisher=People.com|date=2014-12-19|access-date=2015-10-07}} Paslay is featured alongside [[Dierks Bentley]] on [[Charles Kelley]]'s debut solo single "The Driver" which was released on September 28, 2015. "The Driver" received a Grammy nomination for [[Grammy Award for Best Country Duo/Group Performance|Best Country Duo/Group Performance]] for the [[58th Annual Grammy Awards]].{{cite magazine|last1=Vain|first1=Madison|title=Lady Antebellum's Charles Kelly reacts to his Grammy nom for 'The Driver'|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2015/12/07/charles-kelley-grammy-nomination-reaction|magazine=Entertainment Weekly|date=December 7, 2015|access-date=December 9, 2015}} This is Paslay's first Grammy nomination as a recording artist. In October 2015, Paslay released "[[High Class]]" as the lead single to his upcoming second studio album.{{cite web|title=Eric Paslay Releases 'High Class' as New Single [LISTEN]|url=http://theboot.com/eric-paslay-high-class/|work=The Boot|access-date=December 5, 2014}} The album's second single, "Angels in This Town", released to country radio on July 18, 2016.{{cite web|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/eric-paslay-angels-in-this-town/|title=Eric Paslay, 'Angels in This Town' [Listen]|website=Taste of Country|access-date=27 April 2019}} Paslay released a five-song digital extended play, ''The Work Tapes'', in July 2017.{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/hear-eric-paslays-new-ep-the-work-tapes-196233/|title=Hear Eric Paslay's New EP 'The Work Tapes'|first1=Jeff|last1=Gage|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]] |date=28 July 2017|access-date=27 April 2019}} Paslay parted ways with EMI Records Nashville in September 2018. ==Personal life== On April 26, 2015, Paslay married Natalie Harker.{{cite web|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/eric-paslay-married/|title=Eric Paslay Gets Married|first=Billy|last=Dukes|website=Taste of Country|access-date=27 April 2019}} On December 8, 2018 they had their first daughter, Piper Lily Paslay.{{cite web|url=https://people.com/parents/eric-paslay-welcomes-daughter-piper-lily/|title=It's a Girl! Eric Paslay and Wife Natalie Welcome Daughter Piper Lily|website=People.com|access-date=27 April 2019}} Paslay has type 1 diabetes.{{cite web|url=https://beyondtype1.org/eric-paslay-interview/|title=Country Music Star Eric Paslay Talks Life With T1D|website=Beyond Type 1|access-date=30 October 2019}} ==Discography== {{Infobox artist discography | Studio = 2 | Compilation = | Live = | EP = 1 | Singles = 10 (8 Solo & 2 As A Featured Artist) | Music videos = 5 }} ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:12em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:18em;"| Details ! colspan="2"| Peak positions ! rowspan="2" style="width:8em;"| Sales |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! style="width:45px;"| [[Top Country Albums|US Country]]
